message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has hypertension and a history of migraines. Among the options, only propranolol is used for both conditions. Hydrochlorothiazide and lisinopril are used for hypertension only, while prazosin is used for PTSD-related nightmares and hypertension.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s blood pressure is high and she is also experiencing migraine headaches. Among the options, propranolol is the most appropriate choice as it is a beta-blocker that can both lower blood pressure and prevent migraine headaches. Hydrochlorothiazide and lisinopril are also used to treat hypertension but do not have an effect on migraines. Prazosin is an alpha-blocker that is not typically used as a first-line treatment for hypertension.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has a history of migraine with aura and both hydrochlorothiazide and prazosin can exacerbate migraines. Lisinopril may cause a dry cough which can be bothersome. Propranolol is a beta-blocker that is effective in treating migraines and can also control blood pressure. Therefore, Propranolol is the most appropriate pharmacotherapy for this patient.
